channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Reckoning with GDP: Accounting Versus Economics
item.description: Never confuse an accounting identity with a causal economic relationship.

item.title: Inside China’s Massive Tariff-Dodging Scheme That Kills Its Competition
item.description: China's decentralized export machine bypasses traditional retail channels, pays no income taxes, evades tariffs, and undercuts American businesses.

item.title: My solution to Trump’s tariffs: I’m starting a U.S. factory to save my small business
item.description: Supply chains for consumer goods don't have to be overseas, and the benefits to producing in the U.S. extend beyond tariffs.

item.title: The Fertility Crisis Isn’t Just Having Fewer Kids, It’s Women Not Having Any
item.description: The answer to our baby bust isn’t just 'make more babies.' It needs to be 'make more mothers.'

item.title: How Greg Abbott Took On RINOs And Teachers Unions To Pass The Country’s Best School Choice Bill
item.description: The passage of SB 2 is a victory for parental empowerment and a testament to persistence in pursuit of good public policy.

item.title: An Apple exec suggested AI chatbots were eroding Google’s search business, sending Alphabet shares plummeting. The truth is more complicated.
item.description: Alphabet execs insist search volumes are up, but market share is slipping and revenue growth appears to be slowing.

item.description: Papal history is replete with impressive names — Peter, Gregory, Pius, John Paul. But what about the names that didn’t make the cut?

item.description: Foot traffic was down 3.3% YoY in April, following dips of 6.5% in March and 9% in February, according to data from Placer.ai.
